text: Jill Singer (1957 â€“ 8 June 2017) was an Australian journalist, columnist and television presenter. She was born in Korumburra, Victoria. Singer began her career in journalism as an ABC radio trainee in 1984. She eventually became a senior reporter for The 7.30 Report on ABC and later presented the Victorian edition of Today Tonight on the Seven Network. She also presented for The 7.30 Report, The Arts Show, 2-shot and People Dimensions (ABC TV). Singer was the executive producer of ABC TV's national morning news and current affairs program First Edition. She wrote a weekly column for Melbourne's Herald Sun newspaper between 1997 and 2012,Singer gets 'boned' from tabloid column (2 March 2012) and lectured in television journalism at RMIT University in Melbourne. She made regular appearances on The Conversation Hour (ABC 774) and on Sky News Australia's Melbourne Report. Singer died of amyloidosis on 8 June 2017 in Melbourne at the age of 60. ==References== ==Other websites== *Profile on The Australian Women's Register *Brief ABC Art Show biography *Crikey on Today Tonight Category:1957 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from amyloidosis Category:Disease-related deaths in Australia Category:Australian television presenters Category:Australian journalists Category:Writers from Victoria (Australia)
title: Jill Singer
